de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Class BigStepProofModel

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util.beans.AbstractBean
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofModel
          de.unisiegen.tpml.core.interpreters.AbstractInterpreterProofModel
              de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterpreterProofModel, ProofModel, Bean, TreeModel
public final class BigStepProofModel
extends AbstractInterpreterProofModel

This class is the heart of the big step interpreter. A big step proof model consists of any number of BigStepProofNodes, which together make up the big step proof.

Version:
$Rev: 486 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
BigStepProofNode, AbstractInterpreterProofModel

Constructor Detail

BigStepProofModel

public BigStepProofModel(Expression expression,
                         AbstractProofRuleSet ruleSet)
Allocates a new BigStepProofModel with the specified expression as its root node.

Parameters:
expression - the Expression for the root node.
ruleSet - the available big step proof rules for the model.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either expression or ruleSet is null.
See Also:
AbstractInterpreterProofModel.AbstractInterpreterProofModel(AbstractInterpreterProofNode, AbstractProofRuleSet)
Method Detail

guess

public void guess(ProofNode node)
           throws ProofGuessException
Guesses the next proof step for the specified node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
guess in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
guess in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which the next proof step should be guessed.
Throws:
ProofGuessException - if the next proof step could not be guessed.
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.guess(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)

prove

public void prove(ProofRule rule,
                  ProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies the given proof rule to the specified proof node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Specified by:
prove in interface ProofModel
Specified by:
prove in class AbstractProofModel
Parameters:
rule - the ProofRule to apply.
node - the ProofNode to which the rule should be applied.
Throws:
ProofRuleException
See Also:
AbstractProofModel.prove(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofRule, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.ProofNode)
